profile_data.summary: I am a Master's in Robotics graduate from the University of Michigan, Ann Arbor. My long-term goal is to develop algorithms that aid robot autonomy to assist humans in challenging environments. Actively seeking roles that align with my interests, I bring expertise in deep learning, probabilistic robotics, state estimation, sensor fusion, and proficient programming skills in Python and C++.
profile_data.headline: Robotics Engineer | Autonomy, DL for Perception, Planning, Embedded Systems | UAVs, AMRs, and Exoskeletons

experience.description:
- Developed a parametric model with basis function approximations and statistical inference to characterize population-level gait patterns, based on motion capture and force plates data.
- Formulating a factor-graph optimizer to tailor the gait controller of an exoskeleton to an individual’s walking style for enhanced user comfort, by leveraging prior from the parametric model.
experience.title: Research Intern

experience.description: Built an automation calibration system leveraging compound pulley mechanism for calibrating fifteen motion capture VICON cameras spaced across a three-story indoor flight space. Designed and experimented to control the calibration wand in optimal pattern reducing the collective reprojection error of the cameras.
experience.title: Research Associate

experience.companyName: University of Michigan Field Robotics Group
experience.description:
Facilitated and deployed a multi-modal underwater data processing pipeline to enable future 3D reconstruction using BlueROV robot, integrating imaging sonar and monocular camera data:
- built ROS-based Python, C++ drivers and visualization tool for BlueRobotics and Oculus sonars, collecting extensive multi-modal datasets in the Marine Hydrodynamics Lab over three months,
- synchronized multi-modal data and deduced the sensors’ relative pose for extrinsic calibration,
- evaluated custom camera data with cutting-edge NeRF model, showing 33% drop in visual fidelity for low-texture scenes, highlighting need for sonar fusion and motivating future work.

Engineered a shipwreck localization algorithm that processed 100+ km side-scan-sonar data:
- implemented deep learning semantic segmentation models to detect shipwrecks,
- correlated segmented pixels with map positions to derive GPS coordinates with 10m accuracy,
- created a confidence-based metric to rank shipwreck sites by archaeological importance,
- demonstrated results as Shipwreck AI pipeline to the scientific community, TBNMS, NOAA.
experience.title: Graduate Research Student

experience.description:
Led the software development and testing of a 250 kg robot for machining wind turbine blades:
- designed a precise controller for teleoperated omnidirectional mobility with velocity control,
- coded low-level drivers in embedded-C, and high-level control in multithreaded Python,

Contributed to the indoor localization and navigation stack of the autonomous mobile robots:
- led the production and testing of UWB-based satellites forming the Local Positioning System (LPS)
- implemented and integrated IMU-based Kalman Filter into the autonomy stack, ensuring accurate localization during signal dropout from LPS. Achieved less than 1 degree orientation error.
experience.title: Robotics R&D Engineer

experience.companyName: Indira Gandhi Centre for Atomic Research (IGCAR)
experience.description:
- Proposed, executed, rigorously tested and published algorithms in C++ for real-time orientation awareness during nuclear reactor cores inspections, reducing inspection time by 50%.
- Devised a custom mapping system for reactor cores, localized in map using IMU, performed camera-driven inspection and achieved 1ᵒ orientation accuracy in real-time.
experience.title: Intern

publications.name: Real time sub-assembly identification through IMU data fusion with vision sensor for an inspection system
publications.description: The Reactor Core Viewing System in Room Temperature (RCVS-RT) is a system that has been developed to aid in this process for the inspection of the reactor core components. Since the orientation is completely lost during the deployment of the camera probe, it is imperative to implement a feature to overlay the orientation information into the vision data for assisting the user during the inspection. This work explores fusing non-contact sensors with a vision sensor to achieve orientation recognition of the RCVS- RT.

member.occupation: Robotics Engineer | Autonomy, DL for Perception, Planning, Embedded Systems | UAVs, AMRs, and Exoskeletons

publications.name: Volume-DROID: A Real-Time Implementation of Volumetric Mapping with DROID-SLAM
publications.publisher: Advances in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
publications.description: This paper presents Volume-DROID, a novel approach for Simultaneous Localization and Mapping (SLAM) that integrates Volumetric Mapping and Differentiable Recurrent Optimization-Inspired Design (DROID). Volume-DROID takes camera images (monocular or stereo) or frames from a video as input and combines DROID-SLAM, point cloud registration, an off-the-shelf semantic segmentation network, and Convolutional Bayesian Kernel Inference (ConvBKI) to generate a 3D semantic map of the environment and provide accurate localization for the robot. The key innovation of our method is the real-time fusion of DROID-SLAM and Convolutional Bayesian Kernel Inference (ConvBKI), achieved through the introduction of point cloud generation from RGB-Depth frames and optimized camera poses. This integration, engineered to enable efficient and timely processing, minimizes lag and ensures effective performance of the system. Our approach facilitates functional real-time online semantic mapping with just camera images or stereo video input.

member.occupation: Robotics Engineer | Autonomy, DL for Perception, Planning, Embedded Systems | UAVs, AMRs, and Exoskeletons

projects.description:
ArmLab - Designed, scripted and tested a 5DoF manipulator and camera robotic system. Implemented coordinate transformations, camera calibrations, and inverse kinematics for block detection along with sorting and stacking behavior planning algorithms.
BotLab - Built a different drive robot with Lidar for particle file-based SLAM. Designed and tested wheel speed controller, wheel encoder odometry, motion controller, AprilTag localization system and frontier-based explorational path planning algorithms.
projects.title: Robotics System Laboratory

member.occupation: Robotics Engineer | Autonomy, DL for Perception, Planning, Embedded Systems | UAVs, AMRs, and Exoskeletons

projects.description: Reproduced and extended 3D reconstruction of objects using imaging sonars. Represented scene geometry as an implicit function, modeled acoustic wave propagation by a differentiable volumetric renderer and synthesized sonar measurements. Optimized the network by modifying the ray-distance function from SDF to customized TSDF as the extension.
projects.title: Neural Implicit Surface Reconstruction using Imaging Sonar

member.occupation: Robotics Engineer | Autonomy, DL for Perception, Planning, Embedded Systems | UAVs, AMRs, and Exoskeletons

projects.description: The majority of latent space directions discovered by conventional methods globally edit images. The algorithm ReSeFa, was reproduced to locally edit the regions of interest by obtaining semantically meaningful directions from the latent code while achieving reduced computational complexity.
projects.title: Reproducibility study of ”Region-Based Semantic Factorization in GANs”
